text:
Sawaddee ka welcome to hot Thai kitchen today I am 
very excited we got another childhood favorite on

the show so this dish is super classic it's part 
of many Thai people's fond childhood memories

because it's super popular amongst kids it's easy 
to make I used to eat this dish all the time at

my elementary school cafeteria ah so good it is 
what we call kai palo so kai is eggs palo is

five-spice stew so it's basically hard-boiled eggs 
and pork belly and some tofu stew together in this

flavorful five-spice broth today I'm gonna do it 
in my instant pot because it makes it a lot faster

it is the perfect kind of thing for an instant 
pot but if you want to do it stovetop basically

the recipe doesn't change at all so you can just 
follow along no problem alright let's get started

so let's talk the five spices first so the easiest 
way to do it is to just use five-spice powder

which a lot of people do I have a recipe if you 
can make it at home but I prefer infusing whole

spices in this recipe because the powder tends to 
like to set at the bottom and then when you go to

get that last bowl of soup it's just full of like 
this muddy spice powder so I prefer whole spices

so in here I have got cinnamon sticks star anis 
coriander seeds h1 peppercorns and cloves and

I have just toasted these over medium heat until 
they darken a little bit and become really really

aromatic i toast all of them at the same time 
yes I know they don't all take the same amount

of time to toast but I am too lazy to do them all 
individually if you are not go for it oh yay so I

have discovered that you can buy these things 
from the Asian grocery store it's specifically

for making soups and stuff the package looks like 
this so I'm just gonna put these in and I'm also

gonna put in some cilantro stems if you have 
cilantro roots use those I don't and then with

this bag you just flip it like this and then it 
contains the spices in size so they don't leave

like a little tea bag perfect so I will finish 
this in my instant pot but in the beginning I'm

going to start it stovetop just because it is 
faster to do it this way and also these models

really hard for the camera to see because it's 
really deep so I think it's better for you guys

if I do this stovetop first but you can start it 
all the way from the beginning using instant pot

on sautee mode okay first I'm gonna do eyes 
caramelize my palm sugar so this is one of

the keys to the flavor of this dish is the caramel 
flavor of palm sugar so I'm gonna turn this on the

instant pot you want to do this on sautee mode on 
high heat and it will take quite a while another

reason why I like to start on stovetop cause 
have to impatient with the instant pot because it

doesn't get as hot and once it's melting you want 
to keep stirring to evenly distribute the heat if

you don't have palm sugar brown sugar will work 
as well mmm starting to darken now but for this

dish I want to push that a little bit more okay 
that is a nice and intense caramel color going

out go in with my unsalted pork or chicken stock 
unsalted is very important and by adding the stock

it will stop the sugar from caramelizing further 
so you definitely want to have this on hand and

ready to go and the sugar will harden right away 
don't worry that is normal it will dissolve in

time now you can just add the whole thing in but 
since I'm transferring this to the instant pot I

won't I'll just add that in later so I have less 
things to carry around okay the seasonings go in

a lot of different seasonings for a lot of good 
flavor I got some soy sauce as Adam says all the

brown sauces in your kitchen is going into this 
dish I got some golden mountain sauce which is a

type of soy sauce if you don't have it you can 
just use more soy sauce I do have a video all

about the different types of soy sauces I will 
link to that in the dispute below if you don't

know what I'm talking about now also I'm gonna add 
some oyster sauce I forgot to oil my bowl if you

owe your bowl you're not gonna have this issue I 
have okay and then for an even more intense color

because this tube is supposed to be quite dark 
some black soy sauce or you can also do dark soy

sauce but the Thais have black soy sauce which 
is very dark and not very salty so it's a handy

thing to have to adjust color of the dish now in 
goes our spice bag push that down and also I've

got some crushed garlic and the garlic I'm gonna 
leave out of the bag because it's nice it chunks

of stewed garlic and then I've got some ground 
white pepper just for a little bit of pepperiness

because it's adults eating this dish you can do 
less if you're feeding this to children now I'm

gonna bring this to a boil before I transfer it 
to my instant pot because I think it heats faster

on here so this has come to a boil I'm gonna turn 
that off and transfer it into my instant pot now

again to be clear if you're doing this stovetop 
at all of your stock in the pot and bring it to

a boil okay and don't do this half thing that 
I'm doing I'm only doing this because I'm gonna

transfer in it's easier to transfer a small amount 
of liquid okay into the instant off this goes now

the remaining stock goes in and almost forgot I'm 
gonna add just a little bit of salt you can do all

soy sauce and all that stuff but I feel like I've 
got enough soy flavor in there but it still needs

a little bit more salt so I'm gonna do so instead 
okay so now the meat in this recipe is pork belly

so I've got some pork belly here and I made sure 
I pick ones that are leaner than other so I'm

like one of those Asian auntie's at the Asian 
grocery store picking through all the packets

just to make sure I get one without too much 
fat because I prefer a leaner one for this and

you just cut it into pretty large chunks because 
this will shrink down quite a bit so you want to

make it bigger than you want it to be at the end 
pre-baby what I would have done is I would have

seared these pieces of pork until they're nice and 
brown and develop extra flavor but now that I have

a six-month-old at home I barely have time to cook 
let alone develop extra flavor so if you are not

with baby and you have time I highly recommend you 
sear your pork first and I will include details of

how to do that in the written recipe and in this 
recipe you can do more eggs less pork more pork

less eggs whatever you want whatever you prefer 
now if you're doing this stovetop at this point

you're just gonna let it simmer for about two 
hours maybe two and a half depending on the

size of your pork until the pork is fork tender 
okay and also if you're doing the stovetop you're

gonna need more stock than if you were to do it 
instant pot I'll include all the details in the

written recipe because with an instant pot you 
don't lose any liquid to evaporation so we can

start with less stock with the instant pot you're 
gonna cook this on high pressure 20 minutes and

let it natural release for at least 15 minutes 
before we're leaving the rest of the pressure

okay so this has finished a while ago the 
pressure is gone so now just to be sure I'm

just gonna click pressure release so there are 
no surprises I just love how it gives you this

celebratory music every time you think it likes 
congratulations look at that it smells so good

so good now what the port the important thing here 
is you make sure that your pork is fork tender so

I'm gonna just poke it with a I know that's not a 
fork but just give me a break just poke it with a

fork and make sure it goes right through that's 
beautiful while this was cooking what you should

be doing is boil some eggs because after all this 
is Kelo and kite means egg so I've got here some

eggs that I boiled for eight minutes so inside is 
still little bit under because I'm gonna finish

simmering it in here so it'll become hard-boiled 
in the broth here so in they go and in the instant

pot I'll just simmer them on sautee mode for about 
eight minutes now I have to say that traditionally

these eggs are simmered for like half an hour so 
they become like completely overcooked but that's

sort of like how people expect them to be like 
the whites are really hard and rubbery in the egg

yolks all they gray on the inside you can do that 
if you want but I prefer to not overcook my egg so

I only do this stage for about eight minutes and 
then I let it sit in the soup to absorb the flavor

without cooking so I like to do this like a day in 
advance if possible but that's how I come to like

a compromise between having not overcooked eggs 
but the eggs have enough time to sit and absorb

all the flavor now one more thing gonna add to 
here is tofu puffs so if you've never worked with

tofu puff they are fry tofu with an incredibly 
spongy interior they're like a soup sponge it'll

absorb all the soup you chew on them and it's just 
a so much soup just gushes in your mouth that's

delicious comes in a package like this you can 
find it at any Asian grocery store by where you

would buy the tofu and I've just cut these in half 
or quarters just so that they absorb the flavor

even better so some of these are in half some of 
these are in quarters because I got lazy and I was

like forget it we'll just do crafts okay so now 
this just has a simmer for about 8 more minutes

and then we're done how easy is that that smells 
so good and it's done and by the way I almost

forgot to remind you that the spice bag can go now 
don't eat that okay so ideally you would let this

sit at the very least 30 minutes before serving 
because that way you allow the for the flavors to

mingle especially the eggs but for the purpose 
of the show I'm just gonna show you I like to

do this day before I serve it because the bonus 
of that also is the fat once you put it in the

fridge the excess pork fat will can solidify on 
top and then you can remove it I chose some pretty

lean pork belly so I'm not getting too much of the 
fat on top of the soup but sometimes if your pork

is really fatty there's just too much so if that 
happens to you just skim it or you're gonna serve

it tomorrow it'll solidify in the fridge let's 
do one more egg let's eat definitely want to

have this with rice oh I also forgot to tell you 
taste it first the seasoning that I give you is

pretty spot-on but you should always always always 
taste especially when it comes to soup if it's a

little underseasoned add a little more salt or 
more soy sauce whatever you want oh it's perfect

it's perfect mmm okay let's have it with rice and 
you want to like get lots of sauce see you if you

let the eggs sit longer though darken even more 
so we're rushing it here so it's a little light

let's take a look inside the egg ah perfect this 
is what I was looking for the egg is fully cooked

you wanted hard-boiled but we're not getting any 
of that gray ring around the outside that's the

technique that that is unique to my type hello 
if you go to eat I flow in Thailand you will not

get this like you will get the gray ring and 
the egg whites will be a lot more a lot more

rubbery but that's okay just two different styles 
nothing wrong with that nothing wrong with this

it's just FYI some pork and one of the skin side 
because I like the skin the smell of childhood

every time I have this it's like childhood 
memories coming right back like a staple

in like school cafeterias because it's such 
a popular dish so fragrant the eggs the egg

yolk sort of mixes with the sauce and becomes 
as creamy delicious thing in your mouth the

pork belly with skin on when it's braised it's 
so so tender and flavorful and that tofu puffs

good sauce in your mouth ah it is just so 
good a little bit of pepperiness from the

white pepper just enough but it's still a very 
very kid-friendly dish so easy as you can see

just throw everything into the pot and let it 
go whether you do instant pot or regular pot

it is so doable so I hope you give this a try the 
recipe as always will be on hot Thai Kitchen comm

and when you make it send me a photo on Facebook 
Twitter or Instagram and if you haven't subscribe

you should make sure you do so you don't miss an 
episode and click the bell icon as well or you

won't get a notification when I post a new video 
thank you as always for watching and I will see

you next time for your next delicious let it go 
for about 2 hours until the pork is pork tender

to your fork becomes this tender as 
your pork takes about seven years
